The incorporation of electrospun PVA fibers embedded with methylenebisacrylamide and ferro/ferricyanide complexes will enhance the ionic conductivity and mechanical performance of quasi-solid-state polymer electrolytes in high-performance thermal batteries.

The integration of mechanically trained electrospun PVA fibers with methylenebisacrylamide and optimized ferro/ferricyanide concentrations will significantly enhance the ionic conductivity and mechanical properties of quasi-solid-state polymer electrolytes, thereby improving the thermoelectric performance of high-performance thermal batteries.

The incorporation of electrospun PVA fibers modified with methylenebisacrylamide and subjected to mechanical training will improve the ionic conductivity and thermoelectric efficiency of quasi-solid-state polymer electrolytes in high-performance thermal batteries.
